perturbation.original_text: Distributor will pay WGT the full amount invoiced within thirty (30) days after the date of WGT's invoice, unless provided otherwise on the applicable invoice, in the lawful money of the United States of America to WGT by wire transfer of immediately available funds to WGT's bank account number 1141139, at the Commerce Bank of Washington, 601 Union Street, Suite 3600, Seattle, WA 98101, ABA routing number 125008013.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor will pay WGT the full amount invoiced within ninety (90) days after the date of WGT's invoice, unless provided otherwise on the applicable invoice, in the lawful money of the United States of America to WGT by wire transfer of immediately available funds to WGT's bank account number 1141139, at the Commerce Bank of Washington, 601 Union Street, Suite 3600, Seattle, WA 98101, ABA routing number 125008013.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the payment term from 30 days to 90 days can create inconsistencies. While not inherently illegal, such an extended payment term deviates significantly from standard commercial practice (30 days is typical). This deviation could raise concerns under laws related to fair business practices, particularly if it disadvantages the supplier (WGT) without clear justification or mutual benefit. It also delays revenue recognition.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Fair business practices and revenue recognition standards.

perturbation.original_text: At least fifteen (15) days before the beginning of each Quarter during the Term, Distributor will furnish WGT with a rolling revised forecast of Product orders for the remainder of the Term.
perturbation.changed_text: At least five (5) days before the beginning of each Quarter during the Term, Distributor will furnish WGT with a rolling revised forecast of Product orders for the remainder of the Term.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the forecast submission timeframe to 5 days could be problematic. If the law requires a company to be aware of potential market changes and this short time is not enabling a company to accurately gauge those insights before presenting their submission, it could cause issues.

perturbation.original_text: WGT will permit Distributor and end-users purchasing through resellers to return any defective Product in accordance with the limited warranty contained in the applicable end-user license agreement or limited hardware warranty, as applicable, provided that the Distributor and end-user have compiled with the applicable warranty terms and conditions. In order to receive the remedy provided for hereunder, Distributor shall deliver to WGT a sample of the Product which Distributor finds to be defective in workmanship or materials, or damaged in shipment prior to Distributor assuming the risk of loss or damage , along with a written explanation of the alleged defect within thirty (30) days from the later of Distributor's initial receipt of such Product from WGT or from the delivery of such Product to an end-user.
perturbation.changed_text: WGT will permit Distributor and end-users purchasing through resellers to return any defective Product in accordance with the limited warranty contained in the applicable end-user license agreement or limited hardware warranty, as applicable, provided that the Distributor and end-user have compiled with the applicable warranty terms and conditions. In order to receive the remedy provided for hereunder, Distributor shall deliver to WGT a sample of the Product which Distributor finds to be defective in workmanship or materials, or damaged in shipment prior to Distributor assuming the risk of loss or damage , along with a written explanation of the alleged defect within ten (10) days from the later of Distributor's initial receipt of such Product from WGT or from the delivery of such Product to an end-user.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the return window for defective products from 30 days to 10 days could violate consumer protection laws or warranty regulations. In many jurisdictions, a 30-day return window is considered a reasonable standard for defective goods, and shortening it significantly could be deemed unfair or unconscionable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer protection laws and warranty regulations.
